uiDefinition.description: The tenant ID of for the Microsoft Entra ID application

info.title: Office 365 Groups
info.description: Office 365 Groups lets you manage group membership and calendar events in your organization using your Office 365 account. You can perform various actions such as get group roster, add or remove members and create group events.

get.description: This operation returns a list of all members in the given group and their details such as name, title, email, etc. You can query up to 1000 items using Top parameter. In case you need to retrieve more than 1000 values please turn on Settings->Pagination feature and provide Threshold limit.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of group members to retrieve (from 1 to 999, default is 100).

get.summary: When a group member is added or removed
get.description: This operation triggers when a member is added to or removed from the given group.
get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add a member to the group.

post.description: This operation is used to add a member to an O365 group, using a UPN.

parameters.name: userUpn
parameters.description: The user principal name (UPN) of the user.

get.description: This operation returns a list of all groups that you own.
This operation returns a list of all groups that you own.

get.summary: List groups that I own and belong to
get.description: This operation returns a list of all groups that you own and belong to.
This operation returns a list of all groups in the organization.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Enter an OData style filter expression to limit which rows are listed.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Sets the page size of results.

parameters.name: $skiptoken
parameters.description: Token that references the next page of results and is returned in the @odata.nextLink property in the response.

post.description: This operation is used to create a new event in a group calendar.
This operation is used to create a new event in a group calendar.

delete.description: This operation deletes an event in a calendar.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: Select an event

patch.description: This operation is used to update a new event in a group calendar.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: Select an event

delete.description: This operation is used to remove a member from an O365 group, using a UPN.

parameters.name: userUpn
parameters.description: The user principal name (UPN) of the user

get.summary: When there is a new event
get.description: This operation triggers when a new event is added to a group calendar.
get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, create an event in Office 365 Groups.

post.description: Construct a Microsoft Graph REST API request to invoke. There is one segment that is supported: /groups. Learn more: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/use-the-api.

parameters.name: Uri
parameters.description: The full or relative URI. Example: https://graph.microsoft.com/{version}/{resource}.

parameters.name: Method
parameters.description: The HTTP method (default is GET).

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description: The request body content.

parameters.name: ContentType
parameters.description: The content-type header for the body (default is application/json).

parameters.name: CustomHeader1
parameters.description: Custom header 1. Specify in format: header-name: header-value

parameters.name: CustomHeader2
parameters.description: Custom header 2. Specify in format: header-name: header-value

parameters.name: CustomHeader3
parameters.description: Custom header 3. Specify in format: header-name: header-value

parameters.name: CustomHeader4
parameters.description: Custom header 4. Specify in format: header-name: header-value

parameters.name: CustomHeader5
parameters.description: Custom header 5. Specify in format: header-name: header-value

properties.description: Office 365 Groups lets you manage group membership and calendar events in your organization using your Office 365 account. You can perform various actions such as get group roster, add or remove members and create group events.
